content:
Page 4 of 4 pages.
6. With respect to supplies and equipment made available by UNICEF, the Govern- ment will be responsible for the receipt, warehousing and accounting. A storekeeper will be employed on the project who will have direct responsi- bility for the storage, issuing and accounting of supplies. UNICEF supplies will be issued to the project on requisition by a qualified officer designated by the Government. The accounting procedure will conform to the general accounting procedure for UNICEF supplies and will provide the information required by UNICEF.
7. The Government agrees to provide UNICEF, shortly after the end of each fiscal year during the duration of this project, with a certified statement of actual expenditures incurred in the operation of this project to enable UNICEF to secure matching funds from other Governments.
ARTICLE VIII
FINAL PROVISIONS
1. This Plan of Operations will come into effect upon signature by all three parties and will remain in effect until the mass immunization campaign is successfully completed (estimated at three years from the start of the mass immunization campaign), and final project reports have been submitted to UNICEF and the Organization.
2. This Plan of Operations may be modified by mutual consent of the Government, the Organization, and UNICEF. 許躍爾
0022
3. The use of UNICEF supplies and equipment shall be in accordance with the terms of the Basic Agreement between the Government and UNICEF, and no beneficiary or consumer of these supplies will be required to make any payment, direct or indirect, therefor.
4. Upon termination of this project the supplies and equipment furnished under Article VI of this Plan of Operations will be disposed of as mutually agreed between the Government and UNICEF.
IN WITNESS THEREOF the parties hereto, being duly authorized to that effect, have signed this Plan of Operations.
Done in 10 copies in English
At Taipei, on
For the Government of the Republic of China
At Manila, on
For the World Health Organization
At Bangkok, on
For the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund
Bangkok. 4 May, 1953
國史饭 Academia Historica
24

paragraphs.content: 6. With respect to supplies and equipment made available by UNICEF, the Govern- ment will be responsible for the receipt, warehousing and accounting. A storekeeper will be employed on the project who will have direct responsi- bility for the storage, issuing and accounting of supplies. UNICEF supplies will be issued to the project on requisition by a qualified officer designated by the Government. The accounting procedure will conform to the general accounting procedure for UNICEF supplies and will provide the information required by UNICEF.

7. The Government agrees to provide UNICEF, shortly after the end of each fiscal year during the duration of this project, with a certified statement of actual expenditures incurred in the operation of this project to enable UNICEF to secure matching funds from other Governments.

1. This Plan of Operations will come into effect upon signature by all three parties and will remain in effect until the mass immunization campaign is successfully completed (estimated at three years from the start of the mass immunization campaign), and final project reports have been submitted to UNICEF and the Organization.
2. This Plan of Operations may be modified by mutual consent of the Government, the Organization, and UNICEF. 許躍爾

3. The use of UNICEF supplies and equipment shall be in accordance with the terms of the Basic Agreement between the Government and UNICEF, and no beneficiary or consumer of these supplies will be required to make any payment, direct or indirect, therefor.
4. Upon termination of this project the supplies and equipment furnished under Article VI of this Plan of Operations will be disposed of as mutually agreed between the Government and UNICEF.
IN WITNESS THEREOF the parties hereto, being duly authorized to that effect, have signed this Plan of Operations.
